isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM AXLE: INTERNATIONAL - PINION POSITION - PINION SETTING CHART

svcproc.title: PINION SETTING CHART
svcproc.para: Using a micrometer, measure thickness of old pinion shims. Measure each shim separately and add together to get total thickness of original build-up.

note.para: If old pinion shims are bent or mutilated they should be replaced.

svcproc.para: If a new gear set is being used, notice the (+), (-) or "0" etching on both the old and new pinions, and adjust the thickness of the shims to compensate for the difference of these two figures as shown in table, Figure 46 .
For example, if the old pinion is etched +2, and the new pinion is -2, subtract .004 in. from the thickness of original shims used to position pinion.
Use the table, Figure 46, as a guideline to set pinion.
